revised_title: Morphology and Function of the Sporophyte in Splachnum Luteum
tldr: The author investigates the morphology and function of the sporophyte in Splachnum luteum, a type of moss. They describe the structure and development of the sporophyte, including its foot, seta, and apophysis, and discuss the role of the apophysis in nutrient absorption and the possible homology with vascular plant leaves. The author also briefly touches on the relationship between the fetus and mother in infectious diseases.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
